    • Intro to smoothEMr

    Initialize SmoothEM (single- or multi-scale)

    initialize_smoothEM.Rd

    Initialize SmoothEM (single- or multi-scale)

    initialize_smoothEM(
  X,
  method = c("tSNE", "PCA", "random", "multi_scale", "fiedler"),
  rw_q = 2,
  lambda = 10,
  relative_lambda = TRUE,
  K = NULL,
  m_max = 6,
  num_iter = 1,
  modelName = "EEI",
  ridge = 0,
  nugget = 0,
  eigen_tol = NULL,
  keep_history = FALSE,
  include.data = TRUE,
  adaptive = TRUE,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    X

    Numeric matrix (n x d).

    method

    Initialization method. If not "multi_scale", it is passed to initialize_ordering().

    rw_q

    Random-walk order q (default 2).

    lambda

    Penalty strength (default 10). For multi-scale, this is lambda_final.

    relative_lambda

    Logical; default TRUE.

    K

    Number of grid points (only used when method != "multi_scale"). Default: min(30, floor(nrow(X)/5)), with a minimum of 2.

    m_max

    Finest exponent for multi-scale grid (K_final = 2^m_max + 1).

    num_iter

    Number of EM iterations to run (default 1).

    modelName

    Covariance model passed to EM_algorithm().

    ridge

    Ridge passed to make_random_walk_precision().

    nugget

    Nugget passed to EM_algorithm().

    eigen_tol

    eigen_tol passed to objective evaluation inside EM_algorithm().

    keep_history

    Logical; if TRUE and method=="multi_scale", attach the full progressive result in the returned object.

    include.data

    Logical; if TRUE, store the data matrix in the returned object.

    ...

    Extra args passed to initialize_ordering() (when method != "multi_scale"), or to progressive_smoothEM() (when method == "multi_scale").

    Value

    A smooth_em object.

    Contents

    Developed by Ziang Zhang.
